oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion and performances - Southern Streams: Americana Music - 2017-09-13
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performances and panel discussion titled Southern Streams from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 13, 2017. Hosted by Ann Powers. Participants include Don Bryant, Yola Carter, Raul Malo, and Joan Osborne. In partnership with the Americana Music Association.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ann Powers; Don Bryant; Yola Carter; Raul Malo; Joan Osborne;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (12:10) Opening announcements by Abi Tapia / (13:02) Walk-in Music continues / (15:08) Opening comments and introduction of John Ingrassia by Abi Tapia / (16:00) Ingrassia's opening comments / (16:54) Introduction of panel moderator Ann Power / (17:05) Introduction of Ann by Abi / (18:01) Ann with opening comments / (18:23) Ann talks about Americana music, it's history and emergence / (19:17) Ann introduces participants / (23:45) Yola answers question about her obvious main inspirations / (24:23) Raul answers question about his obvious main inspirations / (25:41) Raul is challenged to sing the first lines to O Sole Mio which he does / (26:11) Don answers question about his obvious main inspirations / (28:05) Joan answers question about her obvious main inspirations / (29:42) Joan talks about hidden inspirations that the audience may not know about her being The Sound Of Music and Broadway shows /

(31:12) Don talks about hidden inspirations that the audience may not know about his being Johnny Mathis and different singers like Ray Charles and Howlin' Wolf / (32:29) Raul talks about hidden inspirations that the audience may not know about him being Louis Armstrong and his music / (33:39) Yola talks about hidden inspirations that the audience may not know about her being West Coast music like Gene Clark, The Byrds, Crosby, Stills and Nash, Neil Young, The Beatles and New Orleans rhythm music by Little Feat and Dr. John / (36:26) Raul tells about the influence of Latin music on him and his story about sneaking into a club as a kid with a ska band in Miami / (39:22) Raul talks about his song Come Unto Me and the inspiration for it / (41:30) Raul performs Come Unto Me / (45:17) Joan talks about her self exploration as an artist and how she arrived at where she is today and the tap root of music / (48:30) Joan talks about how Americana Music can incorporate more types of music /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Powers, Ann; Bryant, Don; Carter, Yola; Malo, Raul; Osbourne, Joan; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
